00020 #include <exception>

00025 #include <com/xuggle/ferry/JNIHelper.h>

00027 #include <com/xuggle/xuggler/io/URLProtocolManager.h>

00029 namespace com { namespace xuggle { namespace xuggler { namespace io

00033 
00034 URLProtocolManager::URLProtocolManager(const char * aProtocolName,
00035     jobject aJavaProtoMgr)
00036 {
00037   if (aProtocolName == NULL || aJavaProtoMgr == NULL || *aProtocolName == 0)
00038     throw invalid_argument("bad argument to protocol manager");
00039   // I hate C++; I need to make a copy of the protocol name.
00040   int len = strlen(aProtocolName);
00041   char * protoName = new char[len+1];
00042   strcpy(protoName, aProtocolName);
00043 
00044   this->cacheJavaMethods(aJavaProtoMgr);
00045 
00046   // Now, find the getHandler() factory function method and keep it around
00047   // for later use.
00048 
00049   mWrapper = new URLProtocolWrapper;
00050 
00051   mWrapper->proto.name = protoName;
00052   protoName = NULL;
00053   mWrapper->proto.url_open = URLProtocolManager::url_open;
00054   mWrapper->proto.url_read = URLProtocolManager::url_read;
00055   mWrapper->proto.url_write = URLProtocolManager::url_write;
00056   mWrapper->proto.url_seek = URLProtocolManager::url_seek;
00057   mWrapper->proto.url_close = URLProtocolManager::url_close;
00058   // Unsupported...
00059   mWrapper->proto.url_read_pause = 0;
00060   mWrapper->proto.url_read_seek = 0;
00061   mWrapper->proto.url_get_file_handle=0;
00062   mWrapper->proto.priv_data_size = 0;
00063   mWrapper->proto.priv_data_class = 0;
00064   // and remember ourselves...
00065   mWrapper->protocolMgr = this;
00066 }
00067 
00068 URLProtocolManager::~URLProtocolManager()
00069 {
00070   if (mWrapper == NULL)
00071   {
00072     if (mWrapper->proto.name != NULL)
00073     {
00074       delete [] mWrapper->proto.name;
00075       mWrapper->proto.name = NULL;
00076     }
00077 
00078     delete mWrapper;
00079     mWrapper = NULL;
00080   }
00081   if (mJavaURLProtocolManager_class)
00082   {
00083     JNIHelper::sDeleteGlobalRef(mJavaURLProtocolManager_class);
00084     mJavaURLProtocolManager_class = NULL;
00085   }
00086   if (mJavaProtoMgr)
00087   {
00088     JNIHelper::sDeleteGlobalRef((jobject)mJavaProtoMgr);
00089     mJavaProtoMgr = NULL;
00090   }
00091 
00092 }
00093 
00094 void URLProtocolManager::cacheJavaMethods(jobject aProtoMgr)
00095 {
00096   // Now, let's cache the commonly used classes.
00097   JNIEnv *env=JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00098 
00099   mJavaProtoMgr = env->NewGlobalRef(aProtoMgr);
00100 
00101   // I don't check for NULL here because... well I don.t
00102   jclass cls=env->GetObjectClass(aProtoMgr);
00103 
00104   // Keep a reference around
00105   mJavaURLProtocolManager_class=(jclass)env->NewGlobalRef(cls);
00106 
00107   // Now, look for our get and set mehods.
00108   mJavaURLProtocolManager_getHandler_mid
00109       = env->GetMethodID(
00110           cls,
00111           "getHandler",
00112           "(Ljava/lang/String;I)Lcom/xuggle/xuggler/io/IURLProtocolHandler;");
00113 
00114 }
00115 
00116 URLProtocol* URLProtocolManager::getURLProtocol(void)
00117 {
00118   return (URLProtocol*)mWrapper;
00119 }
00120 
00121 /*
00122  * Here lie static functions that forward to the right class function in the protocol manager
00123  */
00124 int URLProtocolManager::url_open(URLContext* h, const char* url, int flags)
00125 {
00126   int retval = -1;
00127   jstring jUrl= NULL;
00128   jobject jHandler= NULL;
00129 
00130   JNIEnv * env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00131 
00132   try
00133   {
00134     if (!h) throw invalid_argument("missing handle");
00135     URLProtocolWrapper* proto = (URLProtocolWrapper*)h->prot;
00136     if (!proto) throw invalid_argument ("missing proto wrapper");
00137     URLProtocolManager* mgr = (URLProtocolManager*)proto->protocolMgr;
00138     if (!mgr) throw invalid_argument("missing proto mgr");
00139 
00140     // we need to use our manager to get a URLProtocolHandler object to pass
00141     // into the native URLProtocolHandler
00142     // now we need to allocate a new ProtocolHandler and attach it to this
00143     // URLContext
00144     jUrl = env->NewStringUTF(url);
00145     if (!jUrl) throw invalid_argument("should throw bad alloc here...");
00146     jHandler = env->CallObjectMethod(mgr->mJavaProtoMgr,
00147         mgr->mJavaURLProtocolManager_getHandler_mid,
00148         jUrl,
00149         flags);
00150     if (!jHandler) throw invalid_argument("couldn't find handler for protocol");
00151 
00152     URLProtocolHandler* handler = new URLProtocolHandler(proto->proto.name,
00153         jHandler);
00154     h->priv_data = (void*)handler;
00155     retval = handler->url_open(h, url, flags);
00156   }
00157   catch (...)
00158   {
00159     retval = -1;
00160   }
00161   // delete your local refs, as this is a running inside another library that likely
00162   // is not returning to Java soon.
00163   if (jUrl)
00164     env->DeleteLocalRef(jUrl);
00165   if (jHandler)
00166     env->DeleteLocalRef(jHandler);
00167   jUrl = NULL;
00168   jHandler = NULL;
00169 
00170   return retval;
00171 }
00172 
00173 URLProtocolHandler * URLProtocolManager::url_getHandle(URLContext *h)
00174 {
00175   if (!h)
00176     throw invalid_argument("missing handle");
00177   URLProtocolHandler* handler = (URLProtocolHandler*)h->priv_data;
00178   if (!handler)
00179     throw invalid_argument("no URLProtocolHandler set");
00180   return handler;
00181 }
00182 
00183 int URLProtocolManager::url_close(URLContext *h)
00184 {
00185   int retval = -1;
00186   try
00187   {
00188     URLProtocolHandler* handler = URLProtocolManager::url_getHandle(h);
00189     retval = handler->url_close(h);
00190     // when we close that handler is no longer valid; you must re-open to re-use.
00191     delete handler;
00192     h->priv_data = 0;
00193   }
00194   catch (...)
00195   {
00196     retval = -1;
00197   }
00198   return retval;
00199 }
00200 
00201 int URLProtocolManager::url_read(URLContext *h, unsigned char* buf, int size)
00202 {
00203   int retval = -1;
00204   try
00205   {
00206     URLProtocolHandler* handler = URLProtocolManager::url_getHandle(h);
00207     retval = handler->url_read(h, buf, size);
00208   }
00209   catch(...)
00210   {
00211     retval = -1;
00212   }
00213   return retval;
00214 }

00216 int URLProtocolManager::url_write(URLContext *h, const unsigned char* buf,
00217     int size)
00218 {
00219   int retval = -1;

00222     URLProtocolHandler* handler = URLProtocolManager::url_getHandle(h);

00224   }

00232 int64_t URLProtocolManager::url_seek(URLContext *h, int64_t position,
00233     int whence)
00234 {
00235   int64_t retval = -1;
00236   try
00237   {
00238     URLProtocolHandler* handler = URLProtocolManager::url_getHandle(h);

00240   }
00241   catch(...)
00242   {
00243     retval = -1;
00244   }
00245   return retval;
